intro: Piofontia venezuelensis, commonly known as the Venezuelan piofontia, is a rare flowering plant native to the Andean region of Venezuela. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its hairy, woody stems and showy, pentagonal flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils at high altitudes. It has small, elliptical leaves with a pubescent surface. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
